poem:
### The Steel Abyss

In corridors of cold iron dreams,  
a minister gestures, wide-eyed,  
believing words forged in distant lands,  
where tides of trust run thin.  
The steel whispers of forgotten hearths,  
as promises rust quietly.  
Innocence, a brittle alloy,  
shaped by hands that know  
the weight of unkept vows.
